data.name: Accordion1Paragraph2
data.value: If you’re switching to a new tariff, we may review your Direct Debit to make sure your payments cover your usage and any debit balance you might have. If we need to change the amount you pay, we’ll write to you confirming the new amounts.

data.name: Accordion1Paragraph4

data.name: Accordion2Paragraph1
data.value: If you sign up for a new tariff on this website, you’ll stay with your current SSE brand.

data.name: AccordionEPPContent
data.value: Your monthly and annual costs are calculated based on your previous usage, using the unit rates and standing charges for the tariff shown.

data.name: CurrentTariffHeader
data.value: Your current tariff

data.name: DefaultTariffDisclaimer
data.value: If you wish to accept the new tariff, you don’t have to do anything. You’ll automatically change to this at the end of your current tariff. If you prefer to switch to another tariff, have a look at the alternatives below.

data.name: DETooltipText1
data.value: We’ve estimated your energy usage over the next 12 months by calculating your usage over the last year and then applying the industry average to work out the day/night-rate split.

data.name: DETooltipText2
data.value: The average day/night-rate split for Domestic Economy customers is 45% day and 55% night.

data.name: E10TooltipText1
data.value: We’ve estimated your energy usage over the next 12 months by calculating your usage over the last year and then applying the industry average to work out the standard/off-peak rate split.

data.name: E10TooltipText2
data.value: The average standard/off-peak split for Economy 10 customers is 50% standard and 50% off-peak.

data.name: E7TooltipText1
data.value: We’ve estimated your energy usage over the next 12 months by calculating your usage over the last year and then applying the industry average to work out the day/night-rate split.

data.name: E7TooltipText2
data.value: The average day/night-rate split for Economy 7 customers is 45% day and 55% night.

data.name: AvailableTariffsParagraph
data.value: You have the option to switch now. It may be cheaper to switch at the end of your current tariff.

data.name: AccordionEPPContent_CurrentRate
data.value: The estimated costs for your current tariff and the other available tariffs are based on how much energy we expect you to use in the next twelve months, using the unit rates and standing charges for the tariff shown. We’ve included all applicable discounts that you received at the time of your last bill. This information allows you to understand your future energy costs and compare your current tariff with others.</br> The cost projections shown do not take into consideration any recent changes you have made since your last bill or any debit or credit on your account. The monthly and annual forecasts for our tariffs are based on our new prices, which take effect from 1st October 2019.

data.name: AccordionEPPContent_Original
data.value: The estimated cost for your current tariff is based on how much energy we expect you to use in the next twelve months. To calculate the estimated costs, we divide the year into four billing quarters and apply the relevant prices for each quarter. If your current fixed price tariff ends within the next twelve months, we’ve used our standard variable prices to calculate the annual cost for the remaining quarters. If you’ve chosen another fixed price tariff, these prices will be used instead of standard variable prices. We’ve included all applicable discounts that you received at the time of your last bill. This information allows you to understand your future energy costs and compare your current tariff with others. </br>For the other available tariffs to choose from, the projected monthly and annual costs are based on your previous usage, using the unit rates and standing charges for the tariff shown.</br>The cost projections shown do not take into consideration any recent changes you have made since your last bill or any debit or credit on your account.

data.name: AccordionEPPContent_Renewal
data.value: The estimated costs for your new tariff and the other available tariffs to choose from are based on how much energy we expect you to use in the next twelve months, using the unit rates and standing charges for the tariff shown. We’ve included all applicable discounts that you received at the time of your last bill. This information allows you to understand your future energy costs and compare your new tariff with others.</br>The cost projections shown do not take into consideration any recent changes you have made since your last bill or any debit or credit on your account.

data.name: Accordion1SmartHeader
data.value: Smart meters

data.name: Accordion1SmartMeter2
data.value: If you sign up to one of our other fixed price tariffs, you are registering your interest for a smart meter. This means we may contact you in the future to discuss a smart meter installation as and when you become eligible.

data.name: Accordion1SmartMeter3
data.value: We rely on a mobile phone or wireless signal to receive your readings. If these fail, your bills will be estimated.

data.name: NoEarlyExitFeeFF
data.value: No early exit fee for energy

data.name: DDPara1
data.value: If you have a fixed price tariff and pay by Direct Debit or standing order, for most fixed tariffs you’ll get a discount of £40 a year for each fuel when compared to other ways of paying. The discount is applied to your standing charge on a pence per day basis, until your tariff ends.

data.name: DDPara2
data.value: If you have a standard variable tariff, your energy prices are capped and the maximum price you pay (known as a cap) is set by Ofgem, the energy regulator. If you pay by Direct Debit or standing order, your standing charge and unit prices will be discounted. Your discount will vary depending on how much energy you use, where you live and your meter type. If you qualified for Warm Home Discount before 1 August 2019, your prices will be discounted regardless of how you pay.

data.name: DDPara3
data.value: Certain tariffs do not qualify for Direct Debit and standing order discounts. Please check the tariff terms and conditions for details.

data.name: Accordion1SmartMeter1
data.value: If you sign up to our 2 Year Fix and Control tariff, you agree to have a smart meter installed in your property, if you’re eligible and don’t already have one.

data.name: Accordion1Paragraph1a
data.value: We may send your Welcome pack by email. This will include your confirmation of contract, tariff information, terms and conditions and cancellation form.

data.name: NestLink
data.value: https://g.co/nest/ukworks

data.name: NestLinkUrlText
data.value: Nest compatibility checker

data.name: NestLinkUrlTitle
data.value: Check your heating system is compatible with the Google Nest Thermostat E

data.name: SmartHomePackageHeader
data.value: Smart Home Package (with 2 Year Fix and Control)

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage1
data.value: The Smart Home Package, provided by Google, may not be compatible with all heating systems. Please go to the

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage2
data.value: to see if your heating system is compatible before you sign up.

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage3
data.value: The Smart Home Package comes with the 2 Year Fix and Control tariff only. This tariff is available to dual fuel only customers who pay by monthly Direct Debit or quarterly billing only.

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage4
data.value: We’ll send the Smart Home Package to the same address that we supply your energy within 30 working days of your energy application. Someone will need to sign for it.

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage5
data.value: You can install the Smart Home Package yourself. Simply follow the step-by-step

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage5Url
data.value: https://g.co/nest/setupthermostat-e-uk

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage5UrlText
data.value: Nest Thermostat E installation video.

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage5UrlTitle
data.value: How to install the Google Nest Thermostat E

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage6
data.value: or watch the

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage6Url
data.value: http://g.co/nest/setupthermostat-e-uk

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage6UrlText
data.value: installation video

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage6UrlTitle
data.value: How to install the Google Nest Thermostat E

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage7
data.value: If you prefer, we can install it for you for £75. To request an installation, call us on 0345 078 6754 after you sign up.

data.name: SmartHomePackageMessage8
data.value: You’ll need a working internet connection and Wi-Fi to benefit from the Smart Home Package, and we also recommend that you have access to a computer, tablet or smartphone.

data.name: SmartMeter1
data.value: If you sign up to our 2 Year Fix and Control tariff, you agree to have a smart meter installed in your property, if you’re eligible and don’t already have one.

data.name: Accordion1FixAndDriveSmartMeter1
data.value: If you sign up to our 1 Year Fix and Drive tariff, you agree to have a compatible (SMETS2) smart meter installed in your property, if you are eligible and don’t already have one. If you have an older smart meter, we’ll need to upgrade your meter so you can benefit from our off-peak rate. We’ll contact you when you’re eligible for your smart meter installation. If we can’t fit a smart meter, we’ll install an Economy 7 meter so you can use our off-peak rate.

data.name: FixAndDriveHeader
data.value: Drive for free (with 1 Year Fix and Drive)

data.name: FixAndDrivePara2
data.value: You need to own or lease an electric vehicle that you charge at home. We may ask you to prove this. If you’re unable to, we’ll take you off this tariff and put you onto our Standard Variable Tariff.

data.name: FixAndDrivePara3
data.value: We’ll credit your account for the cost of the electricity you use during the off-peak times of your meter, up to 2,000kWh over the year. We’ll spread this credit over the year and apply it to each quarterly bill. We’ll confirm your meter’s off-peak times in your Welcome pack.

data.name: FixAndDrivePara4
data.value: To reach up to 8,000 miles, we checked the test data for the TESLA Model 3 Standard Range Plus (E1R) with the

data.name: FixAndDrivePara4CarFuelLink
data.value: https://carfueldata.vehicle-certification-agency.gov.uk/search-new-or-used-cars.aspx

data.name: FixAndDrivePara4CarFuelLinkText
data.value: Vehicle Certification Agency

data.name: FixAndDrivePara5
data.value: . We multiplied its electric consumption of 4.0 miles per kWh by the up to 2,000kWh of electricity we’ll include over the year. Your mileage will depend on your car and driving conditions.

data.name: FixAndDrivePara1
data.value: The 1 Year Fix and Drive tariff is available to dual fuel only customers who pay by monthly Direct Debit or quarterly billing only.

data.name: FixAndDriveSummaryHeader
data.value: Drive for free

data.name: CurrentTariffBullet1FixAndControlExitFeeTariff
data.value: Early exit fee: £75 per fuel

data.name: PartnershipText
data.value: As we’re now part of the OVO family, we may have cheaper tariff options for you, although some may have eligibility criteria. To find out more, visit ovoenergy.com or call 0330 303 5063, boostpower.co.uk or call 0330 102 7517, or sparkenergy.co.uk or call 0345 034 7474.
